content: Let's face it.  When Congress decided that student loans were no longer able to be discharged in bankruptcy, lenders have had no incentive to perform due diligence on their loans.  The BAPCPA act of 2005 exempted more of these loans than previous, contributing to the problem.Prior to the law there were certainly abuses in student loan programs, but apparently the cure is worse than the disease.  One could hope that legislative action could create a middle ground for due diligence by lenders and moral hazard by borrowers, but bipartisan action is in short supply these days (so I've heard).
